page.title: 04SITE OF NEWARK
page.content: Newark stands on the junction of the Trent and Devon rivers and at the point where The Great North Road crosses the Fosse Way.In recent years the Kelham Road area has been subject to much flooding in the houses due to the rising of the River Trent.The Midland Railway crosses the Great Northen Railway. The population is sited in houses on the fringe of the River Trent adjacent to the Cattle Market.There is also an itinerant caravan site.Some new first homes have been built.The land is flat and highly cultivated.The castle "commands" the higher area. The site of Newark is striking with its imposing castle and busy Cattle Market.There is a Highways Dept,an Agricultural Engineers,a Public House and a Railway Station.
